image.title: The Adam and Dr. Drew Show

channel.title: The Adam and Dr. Drew Show
channel.description: Adam Carolla & Dr. Drew Pinsky reunite the partnership that made Loveline a wild success and cultural touchstone. In each episode Adam and Drew take uncensored, nothing-off-limits, calls about sex, drug, medical and relationship issues. Dr. Drew brings the medicine while Adam's comedy and rants are the spoonful of sugar to make it go down.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Adam Carolla & Dr. Drew Pinsky reunite the partnership that made Loveline a wild success and cultural touchstone. In each episode Adam and Drew take uncensored, nothing-off-limits, calls about sex, drug, medical and relationship...

item.title: Man in the Muira (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.itunes:title: Man in the Muira (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.description: Drew opens the show recapping his second experience singing our nation's anthem, and marvels over how much easier new things are after trying them once. Adam explains how this is part of the process of learning, and how to use that for problem solving using a recent example from his car shop. Drew asks Adam to tell him about the infamous three way stop incident prompting Adam's method for responding to inexplicable hatred. Finally, the guys go to the phones where they speak to one caller who is looking to drop out of college and another who struggles with consequences.

item.title: #1643 You Can't Just Talk to YOUR Obstrecian Anymore
item.itunes:title: #1643 You Can't Just Talk to YOUR Obstrecian Anymore
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the recent 'protest' at a Porsche museum in Germany where several 'activists' glued themselves to the floor in an attempt to bring attention to climate change. The conversation then turns to Drew bringing up the drop in birth rate and the concerns that he has on the subject. They then turn to the phones and speak to a caller who has questions about his pregnant wife potentially getting a Covid booster shot and is looking for advice. They also speak to a caller who points out the candidate Charlie Crist accusing Ron DeSantis of shutting down Florida as a result of Covid.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/Adam2 Mindbloom.com/ADS

item.title: #1642 God Love You
item.itunes:title: #1642 God Love You
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show by going to the phones and speaking with a caller who wants their thoughts on Kanye West's recent comments and the brands that have been severing ties with him as a result of the associated blowback. Adam and Dr. Drew also discuss the recent interview that President Joe Biden sat for with trans activist Dylan Mulvaney as they examine the video and try to figure out the motivation behind this kind of interview in the runup to such an important election cycle.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Nootopia.com/AdamDrewGenius use code AdamDrew10 The Jordan Harbinger Show

item.title: #1641 The Debate Debate Is Over
item.itunes:title: #1641 The Debate Debate Is Over
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing some of the new stuff coming out of the media in regards to Covid as it pertains to our children's education. They also harken back to the night that the decision was made to close schools in Los Angeles as they watch Drew interview a member of the LA School Board and discover a shocking revelation that he had forgotten all about. They also discuss the gubernatorial race in Arizona and check out some bizarre video where Kari Lake's opponent is refusing to debate her on ABC News and can't really come up with a reasonable answer why.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TenThousand.cc/ADS Shopify.com/AdamAndDrew

item.title: Hell-o-Ween (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.itunes:title: Hell-o-Ween (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.description: Adam and Drew open the show discussing documentaries and how quickly they can become exceptionally expensive for a variety of reasons. They have a discussion about masks and the lack of continuity when it comes to use methods before Adam explains why the founding fathers and how they couldn't have possibly foreseen. They then go to the phones and speak to a caller who is newly on Vivitrol and experimenting with marijuana, another who has thoughts on personal responsibility and much more.

item.title: #1640 Apologize NOW!
item.itunes:title: #1640 Apologize NOW!
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a recent interview that Dr. Drew did with a cardiologist that freaked out one of his producers as they discussed the risks associated with them. They then turn to the phones to speak to a caller who has complications after getting vaccinated, leading Adam back to his long standing thoughts on trajectories and how they just keep going. They also speak with a caller who has thoughts on comedian Billy Eichner and wants the guy's take, as well as another who is looking to get an honest conversation about vaccines into mainstream media. As the show wraps up
Please Support Our Sponsors: Mindbloom.com/ADS promo code ADS Geico.com

item.title: #1639 Even The Roof Had No Personality
item.itunes:title: #1639 Even The Roof Had No Personality
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a video clip that resurfaced for Adam recently featuring March 2020 remarks from then President Trump talking about filling the United States oil reserves because at the time oil prices had plunged as a result of Covid. Adam also harkens back to his childhood as he attempts to illustrate what he was surrounded by in terms of culture and role models. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who wants their take on how American society might react to the reality of nuclear weapons being used. They also speak to another caller who is divorced and in his 40s dating a 24 year old woman who wants him
Please Support Our Sponsors: Geico.com

item.title: #1638 Nice is Parsley
item.itunes:title: #1638 Nice is Parsley
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Dr. Drew asking about Adam's interview last week with former Biden family business associate Tony Bobulinski and what Adam learned from the interview. Drew also tells Adam about an observation that he had recently when he was out in a Los Angeles Starbucks and noticed that many young people were alone and engaged with their screens without any seeming purpose or sense of happiness.
Please Support Our Sponsors: JimmyJane.com promo code Adam&Drew25 Geico.com

item.title: Victim of Circumference (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.itunes:title: Victim of Circumference (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.description: Adam and Dr Drew open up the show talking about how Adam bartered his way onto the radio before an imposter caller brings up the flat earth movement. Later on, Adam explores his analogy about cars and the male libido before they take a call and explain the key difference between "have to" and "get to". Finally, a caller looking for help with her sister leads Adam to break down why he believes that making a person feel like a victim is the surest way to ruin their life.

item.title: #1637 Be Suspicious
item.itunes:title: #1637 Be Suspicious
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the traffic jam that Adam found himself in yesterday at the height of rush hour thanks to President Biden's arrival in Los Angeles. After marveling at the idea of his landing right in the heart of rush hour in the traffic capital of the world they go on to examine his planned schedule during the visit. They also discuss the hand washing hysteria that existed during the early days of covid before turning to the phones and speaking with a caller who wants to discuss the recent controversy surrounding the NFL and head injuries specifically as it relates to Tua Tagovailoa. They also discuss former NFL player Chris Borland who retired early at age 24.
Please Support Our Sponsors: LiquidIV.com promo code ADS TommyJohn.com/ADS Cigora.com promo code SHOW10 Nootopia.com/AdamDrewGenius promo code AdamDrew10

item.title: #1636 Things Have Shifted Quite a Bit
item.itunes:title: #1636 Things Have Shifted Quite a Bit
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing President Joe Biden and comments he made on the campaign trail back in the 1980s that were almost immediately debunked with Adam explaining that after seeing that clip he knew all he needed to know about Biden when he get agitated. They also watch the recent interview that President Biden did with Jake Tapper and examine his shocking lack of followup. Later they turn to the phones and speak with a caller who wants an update on something Adam used to say frequently that doesn't seem to be the case today.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Con-Cret.com/Podcast Roman.com/ADS SimpliSafe.com/Adam2

item.title: #1635 We Must Act!
item.itunes:title: #1635 We Must Act!
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a recent conversation that Dr. Drew had with a psychologist who helped Drew to put a finer point on the fact that many of the lockdowns enacted during Covid were at the behest of major media institutions and Adam makes an insightful observation about the 'need to act'. They also discuss a comment that the same psychologist made to Drew about how many women are coming to his practice and lamenting that they miss 'men being men'. Adam also discusses 'pattern breaks' and how it helped Adam cut through the Covid hysteria much much faster than the general populace.
Please Support Our Sponsors: RocketMoney.com/ADS FastGrowingTrees.com/ADS JimmyJane.com promo code Adam&Drew25

item.title: Trough Guy (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.itunes:title: Trough Guy (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.description: Adam opens up the show talking about the podcast becoming his longest running gig before explaining his trickle method to keeping the trough full. Adam explains why he doesn’t think white supremacy should be leading the news and plays audio of Candace Owens in front of a Congressional hearing backing his assertion. The guys take a call about Philando Castile leading adam to explain his position on racism.

item.title: #1634 He Lacks Charisma
item.itunes:title: #1634 He Lacks Charisma
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show talking about Adam's grandmother's (then Hellen Johnson) friend Harry Hay, a celebrated leader in the early gay movement. They also roll the tape on her appearance in Adam's construction TV show 'The Adam Carolla Project' and examine some of the quotes from that appearance. Adam also recounts a time that he got sucked into a conversation about The Feast Of San Gennaro only to have his grandmother drop a massive Bon Jovi Uno reverse card on him and totally sucking the wind out of Adam's sails.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Babbel.com/ADS TenThousand.cc/ADS Cigora.com use code SHOW10 BlindsGalore.com let them know we sent you
item.content:encoded:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show talking about Adam's grandmother's (then Hellen Johnson) friend Harry Hay, a celebrated leader in the early gay movement. They also roll the tape on her appearance in Adam's construction TV show 'The Adam Carolla Project' and examine some of the quotes from that appearance. Adam also recounts a time that he got sucked into a conversation about The Feast Of San Gennaro only to have his grandmother drop a massive Bon Jovi Uno reverse card on him and totally sucking the wind out of Adam's sails.

item.title: #1633 A Butt Funnel of Esteem!
item.itunes:title: #1633 A Butt Funnel of Esteem!
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing esteem and why so many people identify esteem incorrectly in those around them. They also discuss the insanity going on at Amherst college as well as the crazy story surrounding a girl's volleyball team at a high school in Vermont. Adam and Drew also discuss the problems that have arisen as a result of people who may be of diminished intellect who are not aware of it. Drew also recounts a conversation that he had with an Uber driver on the way in and how it illuminated to him how California is unsustainable for many, if not most middle class families. As the show wraps up the guys discuss gas prices in California and speak to a caller with a story about Gavin Newsom that didn't get much media attention.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Con-Cret.com/Podcast Download InvestAll and use code Adam The Jordan Harbinger Show BlindsGalore.com let them know we sent you

item.title: #1632 Why Is That Attractive?
item.itunes:title: #1632 Why Is That Attractive?
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show marveling at some of the things they are hearing out of politicians that just outright don't make sense. To bolster the point Adam shares with Dr. Drew some video of the Mayor of New Orleans commenting on recent stats declaring New Orleans the murder capitol of America. After marveling at the lack of an answer that was provided by an elected Mayor of a major city they turn to the phones and speak to a caller with a question about Bill O'Reilly and his habits when interacting with his guests. As the show wraps up they speak to one more caller with a question about the hysteria that seems to be surrounding this year's flu season.
Please Support Our Sponsors: MoinkBox.com/ADS SimpliSafe.com/Adam2 Shopify.com/adamanddrew BlindsGalore.com let them know we sent you

item.title: Aging Redrum (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.itunes:title: Aging Redrum (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.description: Adam and Dr. Drew open the show breaking down a video wherein The Young Turks were berating Adam for his thoughts on school breakfast while not really making any cohesive points. Dr. Drew talks about a revelation he had about some places in his life where he feels he has been falling short and feels he needs to atone for and the strange feeling that he got in the process. The guys go to the phones where a caller is wondering if he can date someone he know through AA before Drew explores why it took him so long to see 'The Shining'.

item.title: #1631 You Declared Yourself!
item.itunes:title: #1631 You Declared Yourself!
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show continuing their discussion about Adam's former appearance on HuffPo Live talking about his interview with Gavin Newsom and whether or not it was 'fair'. This leads Drew to discuss some of the off social media interactions he has had with various doctors he's interacted with online. They also review a video that The Young Turks made once upon a time giving crazy analysis to comments Adam made on free school breakfast. As the show wraps up they speak do a caller who has thoughts on the correlation between 'chick think' and fruity drinks.
Please Support Our Sponsors: BlindsGalore.com Let them know we sent you SimpliSafe.com/Adam2 Cigora.com use code Show10

item.title: #1630 Unless There's a Physical Pipeline
item.itunes:title: #1630 Unless There's a Physical Pipeline
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show by heading to the phones and speaking with a caller who wants to bring up the year old clip of President Biden saying that the best thing to do to prepare for hurricane season is to get vaccinated. They also harken to Adam's appearance on HuffPo Live discussing family, education & the school to prison pipeline. Adam also explores a Ray Stevens hit from 1970 and compares it to some of the messaging still around to today's society. Later they speak with a caller who wants to highlight a story going around about renaming insects that have names deemed to be offensive for a variety of reasons.
Please Support Our Sponsors: JustWorks.com Mindbloom.com/ads Promo Code ads BlindsGalore.com Let them know we sent you Nootopia.com/AdamDrewGenius use code AdamDrew10

item.title: #1629 Food Motivated
item.itunes:title: #1629 Food Motivated
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing motivation both as it relates to an in-studio Phil (Adam's dog) and government's relationship with its citizens and dealing with problems. Drew also tells Adam about the conversations he has been having with people who have been "silenced" throughout the Covid pandemic and what he has learned throughout the process. Adam also recounts a TV commercial he saw recently that focuses on age, as he has tried to do since the first week of the pandemic. They also turn to the phones and speak to callers about 'long covid' leading to an epic Adam rant.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS TenThousand.cc/ADS Con-Cret.com/Podcast BlindsGalore.com Let them know we sent you

item.title: Hacking up Hollywood (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.itunes:title: Hacking up Hollywood (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.description: Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the story regarding Kathy Griffin and celebrity attorney Lisa Bloom before examining what about Drew and his behavior tends to lead Adam to thinking that Drew can be classified as a puss. Adam gives his tips on how to spot a hack in Hollywood as he laments the creatively bankrupt entertainment products that plagued his childhood. The guys take a call about a vape lounge owner who's fighting an ordinance to change the restricted age to 21 instead of 18.

item.title: #1628 You Go Find It
item.itunes:title: #1628 You Go Find It
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew turn straight to the phones and start with a caller who wants to talk about the BYU Duke volleyball scandal where it was alleged that BYU fans were shouting racial slurs at Duke players. They also speak to a caller who has concerns surrounding a proposed law that would require reporting of people with mental illness potentially being limited in practices like buying a gun or other things and how that may lead to people avoiding treatment. Drew also brings up Adam's recent Adam Carolla Show interview of Sid Krofft and how pleasantly surprised Drew was with how it went. They also touch on Puff, The Magic Dragon before heading back to the phones to speak to a caller with a question about echocardiograms & affirmative action.
Please Support Our Sponsors: LiquidIV.com use code ADS Roman.com/ADS

item.title: #1627 I've Solved The Problem
item.itunes:title: #1627 I've Solved The Problem
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show talking about the recent news story concerning a Canadian shop teacher who has been gaining notoriety as a result of some parents having concerns about her over exaggerated appearance. They go on to have a discussion about fetishes and how it's possible that the fetish of reaction is a new component that isn't being explored. Adam also explains why the school defending the actions of that teacher is a dangerous road to venture down. Drew then turns the conversation to the recent trend of (largely) red states transporting migrants to blue cities and they juxtapose the answer that Jen Psaki gave a year ago to what is going on today.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Con-Cret.com/Podcast The Jordan Harbinger Show Download InvestAll and use promo code Adam

item.title: #1626 Trajectories!
item.itunes:title: #1626 Trajectories!
item.description:
Dr. Drew joins Adam remotely from his home in New York and they open the show with Drew telling Adam about a finance expert he interviewed who has interesting thoughts on how the Covid vaccines relate to excess deaths. Adam also explains how he is an expert of trends and trajectories and how well that served him as the pandemic has unfolded and been reported on by the media. They also discuss the confusing situation unfolding where President Biden has said publicly that the pandemic is over yet California still remains under an emergency order. They also explore freedom when it applies to different states in our country.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Con-Cret.com/Podcast Cigora.com Use Code SHOW10

item.title: Killing Me Soft Drinks (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.itunes:title: Killing Me Soft Drinks (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.description: Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Dr. Drew's rekindled love for 'The Love Boat' as Adam explains his theory behind the value in examining commercials and popular entertainment of a time period as it represents what our society is like during that time. Adam then explains his position on personal responsibility and the infirmity of today's youth. As the show wraps up, radio host Ben Shapiro calls in to talk about the controversy stirred up when he was on Drew's HLN TV show.

item.title: #1625 That's Not How Nature Works
item.itunes:title: #1625 That's Not How Nature Works
item.description:
Adam opens the show telling Dr. Drew about a strange YouTube rabbit hole that he found himself going down when his normal TV programing wasn't working leading to a global analysis of why humans have such a fear of insects. They also speak to a caller who is wondering how we can go back from the intermingling of politics & public health policy. After Adam shows Drew a commercial he saw recently about what foods people should be eating. They also discuss, as much as they can, a project that Dr. Drew filmed for an upcoming Fox TV show that'll be premiering in January 2023. Adam also recounts an insane interaction he had with his mother that was almost too on brand to handle. 

Please Support Our Sponsors:

MagBreakthrough.com/adamdrew

Con-Cret.com/Podcast

Babbel.com/ADS

LiquidIV.com use code ADS

Adam also recounts an insane interaction he had with his mother that was almost too on brand to handle.

item.itunes:title: #1624 It's a Meritocracy To a Point
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Dr. Drew's recent work on the TMZ Michael Jackson documentary as Drew recounts the experience and cleans up a slight error in what he said there, the conversation then turns to Adam's brief appearance in a recent episode of 'Jay Leno's Garage' leading to a trip down memory and pit lanes. Adam also recalls the joke that his grandmother regarded as hilarious that Adam knew wasn't, helping to inform his confidence in his sense of humor from a young age.

item.title: #1623 Infusing Chick Think
item.itunes:title: #1623 Infusing Chick Think
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing some of the shenanigans going on involving our local Los Angeles elected officials enriching themselves and those around them in a way that is very possibly illegal. They also discuss the dishonesty that runs rampant in the news media using the infamous 'Carollaectomy' as reported by Entertainment Weekly back in the day. They also speak with a caller who has a theory surrounding the death of George Floyd and discuss the importance of factoring in one's 'batting average' when accessing information. They also speak with a caller who has thoughts on homelessness especially as it exists in California.

The conversation then turns to a harrowing tale of egg, cheese and disappointment.

item.title: #1622 No Cock & Balls
item.itunes:title: #1622 No Cock & Balls
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the recent White House directive that yearly Covid vaccinations would be required annually in perpetuity. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who has questions about Adam's 'crystal brain' as it pertains to big pharma and the Covid vaccines. Adam also explains to Drew how we got to where we are and why the 'chick think' narrative he has been talking about for years has never been more applicable than it is today. As the show wraps up Adam points to a new Dennis Prager article that lines up with his thinking perfectly.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Con-Cret.com/Podcast TenThousand.cc/ADS Justworks.com

item.title: #1621 Where'd He Get That Information?
item.itunes:title: #1621 Where'd He Get That Information?
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show watching and discussing the July 2020 commercial produced by the DNC giving their take on Trump's opinions on schools early in the Covid pandemic. They also explore some past CNN headlines from a similar time in an attempt to see how they have aged. Adam then breaks out the boxing analogies in an effort to describe the changes in CNN's reporting style as time has passed. They also speak to a caller who wants to get the guys' take on a tragic story out of Memphis involving the kidnapping and death of a young mother & teacher.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Mindbloom.com/ADS AirMedCareNetwork.com/ADS

item.title: #1620 Point To The Sky And Say 'We're Doomed'
item.itunes:title: #1620 Point To The Sky And Say 'We're Doomed'
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the recent heat wave that has been hitting Southern California and point out what various groups attribute the heat to. Dr. Drew then turns the conversation towards California AB 2098 and the concerns that he has surrounding the controversial bill. They also speak with a caller who has questions about the lack of investigation surrounding Jeffrey Epstein and the cadre of people who have reportedly flown on his jet and visited his island, with some of Adam's friends amongst them.
Please Support Our Sponsors: MoinkBox.com/ADS Con-Cret.com/Podcast SimpliSafe.com/Adam2

item.title: #1619 I Can Solve This With Fudge
item.itunes:title: #1619 I Can Solve This With Fudge
item.description:
Drew opens up the show discussing the recently advanced Bill 2098 in California that would allow for medical doctors to be punished for disseminating "medical misinformation" and what wide ranging implications such a law could bring. They also speak with a caller who has questions about the omicron variant and how we are approaching combating it. Adam also tells Drew a story about Sonny who is actively attempting to remain calm and alleviate anxiety and the advice Adam gave him along the way with an unexpected assist from Jay Leno along the way. They also speak to a caller with thoughts about Covid messaging. As the show wraps up Drew points to some people who have seen the light when it comes to Covid and his eagerness to point those corrections out and welcome them back to the fold.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Babbel.com/ADS TommyJohn.com/ADS Con-Cret.com/Podcast

item.title: #1618 Stop Talking About This Shit, I Got Kids
item.itunes:title: #1618 Stop Talking About This Shit, I Got Kids
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a recent interaction that Adam had on his way to film a TV show with Byron Allen and the variety of insane Covid protocols that he came across along the way. Adam also discussed 'Marranos' and how the ancient term is poised to make a comeback as people are scared to speak their minds. Adam also discusses the idea of 'padding' when it comes to significant events needed to be embellished. Adam and Dr. Drew also review a recent appearance by Rob Reiner on 'Real Time with Bill Maher' and they break down the game film on Rob's answers. 

Please Support Our Sponsors:

GetRoman.com/ADS

Con-Cret.com/Podcast

item.title: #1617 That's Dominion
item.itunes:title: #1617 That's Dominion
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a recent interview Drew did with a doctor who was cancelled for expressing concerns over Covid vaccine mandates. They also harken back to the comments made by Rochelle Walensky in regards to her children being allowed to go to summer camp. Adam also recounts his recent experience shooting a tv show where he had more than one person come up to express that they agree with his take on Covid but can't express it for fear of losing their job. They then turn to the phone and speak to a caller who wants a third category added to Adam's 'stupid or liar'. They also speak to a caller who recently read Adam's book and wants to discuss people who have been 'deputized' post covid and are exercising any power they can find.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TenThousand.cc/ADS Con-Cret.com/Podcast American Hartford Gold - offers.americanhartfordgold.com/adam/

item.title: #1616 We Can Do Whatever We Want
item.itunes:title: #1616 We Can Do Whatever We Want
item.description:
Dr. Drew opens the show telling Adam about a story he saw about an impending misinformation czar that is apparently coming to California soon governing Doctors. Drew also reveals that he has been persuaded that for much of the early pandemic there was a policy of terrorizing the citizens until they could get to an effective vaccine. They also review the tape of SoFi administrator Russ Simons, explaining the rules for in person attendance of the Super Bowl and examining how it's aging. Adam also shows Drew some 1970s movie trailers as they marvel at what passed for mainstream entertainment in those days. They also speak to a caller looking for the return of the infamous piano tuner magnet.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Con-Cret.com/Podcast TommyJohn.com/ADS BlindsGalore.com tell them we sent you

item.title: #1615 Sometimes You Just Punt
item.itunes:title: #1615 Sometimes You Just Punt
item.description:
Drew opens the show discussing how he has been engaging with Twitter more and how that has been impacting him in a variety of ways. They also talk about a recent interview that Dr. Drew did where his guest posited that former President Trump's use of the word Hydroxychloroquine may have been the moment in time that our country's divide was supercharged. Plus, they take a caller with a "unique" offering from Ted Knight.
Please Support Our Sponsors: BlindsGalore.com tell them we sent you Con-Cret.com/Podcast

item.title: #1614 Retardanoia
item.itunes:title: #1614 Retardanoia
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a tweet that Dr. Drew saw accusing him of being 'Fox News-centric' leading to a larger conversation about groups and paranoid assumptions. Adam also recalls his experience appearing on 'The Doctors' and how a civil disagreement is still a very real thing that can occur without larger conflict. Drew also recounts a recent experience he had at a party that led to a life long decision regarding cannabis. They also review the game film on a recent interaction between President Biden and a reporter asking about student loan relief and discuss the general problem with politicians of an advanced age. They also speak to a caller who is looking for advice to support a friend with an addiction issue.
Please Support Our Sponsors: BlindsGalore.com tell them we sent you Con-Cret.com/Podcast

item.itunes:title: Drewplicate (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.description: Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew observing for the first time ever the disproportionate amount of their time that they, and Adam especially, spend in the studio. The guys then welcome in friend of the show Jordan Harbinger and they launch into a discussion about cognitive dissonance and how it is expanding into the general American culture. Adam also shares some thoughts on comments made recently by Mindy Kaling before the guys turn to the phones and speak to callers on a variety of topics.

item.title: #1613 You Can't Write This Unless You're Highly Evolved
item.itunes:title: #1613 You Can't Write This Unless You're Highly Evolved
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show reminiscing on old primate sidekicks performing musicals back in the day which reminds Dr. Drew of some of his all time favorite bits as they take some time to watch 'The History of Man' and 'Mascul-OUT' and finally 'Rest Assured'. They also speak to a caller who wants their thoughts on how organizations like Cal Osha are still sticking to their now confusing Covid policies. They then turn right back to the laughs as they watch more classic Man Show bits.

item.title: #1612 The Quiet Narcissism
item.itunes:title: #1612 The Quiet Narcissism
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing narcissists and the phenomenon of 'quiet narcissists' and how they can fly under the radar while being far more narcissistic than someone who outwardly appears narcissistic. They then speak to a caller who wants to know how it is possible that she and her best friend despite being raised in very similar environments can be so diametrically opposed on topics like politics and covid response. They also speak with a caller who is dealing with Adjustment Disorder and his loss of custody of his children. Adam also takes a quick detour to harken back to Mike Tyson's back to back fights with Donovan 'Razor' Ruddock wherein Tyson remarked that Ruddock's hits feel like a mule kick. 

Please Support Our Sponsors:

Con-Cret.com/Podcast

item.title: #1611 That's What They Do, That's Not What I Do
item.itunes:title: #1611 That's What They Do, That's Not What I Do
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show talking about Adam's recent 'Adam Carolla and Friends' show at the Hollywood Improv and why it took him so long to come around to executing an idea that he was readily aware of for an extended period of time. Dr. Drew also brings up a recent conversation that he had with Alex Berenson wherein he asked Alex to do some self-assessment only to discover that he has largely been correct on many topics in the past few years. Adam also harkens back to the approaching two year anniversary of an article Newsweek wrote about Adam's 'false claims' on Twitter about Covid.

item.title: ReDrew (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.itunes:title: ReDrew (The Adam and Dr. Drew Show Classics)
item.description: Adam and Drew start off speaking about Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti's state of the city speech and the comments that he made regarding the city's homeless population and his somewhat nonexistent actions to backup his words. Later on the guys are joined by renowned astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson and they discuss what potential solutions exist for the human inflicted climate change that everyone agrees the earth is experiencing. To finish things off Adam and Dr. Drew express their thoughts on appreciation of achievement and how that manifests itself using cars as a metaphor.

item.title: BEST OF: #1423 Good Luck Un-Ringing The Dumb Bell
item.itunes:title: BEST OF: #1423 Good Luck Un-Ringing The Dumb Bell
item.description: Drew opens the show vexed by someone who was asking him about 'Big Pharma' and he attempts to have Adam help him understand what exactly he is able to do as a healthcare professional when someone has such feelings. They then review the breaking news (as we record) that the CDC has advised that fully vaccinated people do not need masks in indoor or outdoor settings save for some rare exceptions. They also review a clip of Adam on 'The Doctors' in late 2020 with some views that while controversial at the time, have aged very well.

Later they discuss how tuned out people have become and examine some comments made about Adam by another radio host.

item.description: Adam and Drew open today's episode of The Adam and Drew showing talking about celebrities who use external manifestations to hide something about their personal life that they don't want the public to know about. The conversation later turns to the tragic passing of Tom Petty and how opiates played a role in his death. After turning to the phones, a call about Drew's shoulder pain inspires Adam to reimagine the lyrics of a Jimmy Dean Classic.

item.title: #1610 What Else Might You Be Wrong About?
item.itunes:title: #1610 What Else Might You Be Wrong About?
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing 60 second life in review videos of older actors and what they accomplished in their careers. They also discuss vaudeville and Pagliacci leading to a conversation about music pitting Smokey Robinson's 'Tears of a Clown' against Prince's 'Erotic City' with a very animated Adam giving his thoughts. Drew later circles back to his studies of performers and points out his astonishment that many, if not most of those who succeeded came from affluent backgrounds. They also discuss how that phenomenon translates to very little today with the notable exception of Formula 1 racing. The discussion of racing leads Adam to harken back to his childhood and experiences of going to Malibu Grand Prix with friend's fathers.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Con-Cret.com/Podcast GetRoman.com/ADS Babbel.com/ADS

item.title: #1609 People Have Feelings and They Know Things / The Gift of Low Self-Esteem
item.itunes:title: #1609 People Have Feelings and They Know Things / The Gift of Low Self-Esteem
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show trying to figure out the recent controversy with the 'Turning Point USA Nazis' as described on The View and why the focus doesn't seem to be in the right place. Adam also laments people who "know things" in today's covid age despite not having information that is remotely correct. Adam also explores how kids tell stories and how that methodology applies to adults who don't think straight but rather let feelings bleed into their storytelling. Adam and Drew also explore the different ways that people respond to attention and how attention can be viewed as a currency by some in a way others do not. They also speak to a caller who has a question about an impending ACS guest that leads to a highly confusing situation. 

Please Support Our Sponsors:

MagBreakthough.com/adamdrew

SimpliSafe.com/Adam2

Con-Cret.com/Podcast

American Hartford Gold - offers.americanhartfordgold.com/adam/

item.title: The Drew-Over (The Adam and Dr Drew Show Classics)
item.itunes:title: The Drew-Over (The Adam and Dr Drew Show Classics)
item.description: Adam opens the show telling Drew about a phone call he had with his father just moments before the show started and tells Drew about the contents of the call, including wether or not The Oscars came up… after Jimmy Kimmel had hosted for his first time. They also discuss calls from the left to make President Trump release his tax returns and the unfortunate reality of how wealthy people interact with and attempt to defeat the tax code within the confines of the law. And finally, Adam and Drew’s initial false start for the phones leads them to figure the formula for a flaccid phallus and the telling of tool time. Followed by and attempt to create more COMRADErie in California.
item.content:encoded: Adam opens the show telling Drew about a phone call he had with his father just moments before the show started and tells Drew about the contents of the call, including wether or not The Oscars came up… after Jimmy Kimmel had hosted for his first time. Followed by and attempt to create more COMRADErie in California.

item.title: #1607 Look The F Around
item.itunes:title: #1607 Look The F Around
item.description:
Adam opens the show FIRED UP on the heels of the last show where he was telling Dr. Drew that he knows everything because he knows nothing. They also speak to a caller who is worried about his pediatrician's judgement when it comes to advocating and even pushing him to get his children vaccinated against Covid. They also speak to a caller who is trying to simplify the debate around the terms 'man' and 'woman'. As the show wraps up Adam rants about his love of cars and how it relates to some of the recent comments from President Biden.

item.title: #1606 She Has a Feeling as a Mom
item.itunes:title: #1606 She Has a Feeling as a Mom
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the idea of being very good at something and how that's empowering for employees who are capable enough to not be bullied. Adam also recounts some of his own experiences with getting bullied by those who thought they were in a position of power and how he dealt with the situations. They also speak to callers including one who wants Drew to inspire doctors to revolt against the Covid misinformation plaguing our media. Adam also revisits a clip of Gavin Newsom on The Adam Carolla Show discussing homelessness. As the show wraps up they speak with a caller who is questioning the ongoing use of emergency use authorizations still in use for the Covid vaccine.
Please Support Our Sponsors: offers.americanhartfordgold.com/adam/ BlindsGalore.com let them know we sent you

item.title: #1605 A Little Bit
item.itunes:title: #1605 A Little Bit
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew reunite this week and open the show discussing Dr. Fauci's temporary bend towards sanity that quickly snapped back. They also discuss the role that media companies played in amping up or dampening down stories depending on the political outcome that they wanted to see. They also discuss a recent YouTube strike that Adam's channel suffered as a result of a conversation between Drew & Mark Geragos on a recent episode of Reasonable Doubt, revisiting the video in question. As the show wraps up Adam brings back up his 'chick think' idea that he has been hammering for decades that is finally coming to light.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Con-Cret.com/Podcast TommyJohn.com/ADS BlindsGalore.com Let them know Adam sent you

item.title: #1604 Speed Kills
item.itunes:title: #1604 Speed Kills
item.description:
Drew and Mark finish up their week of shows today and they open discussing the wild case of Alex Murdaugh who stands accused of many crimes from money laundering to murder of his own wife and son, amongst other crimes. They also discuss Methamphetamine and PCP as Mark asks for Drew's experiences with treating people who use those various substances. They also bemoan the state of mental healthcare in America and discuss the different and superior ways that other countries approach the issue and try to help fix people. They also speak to a few callers including one who had a tumor removed and is wondering if he is susceptible to more as he ages and another who is experiencing bad side effects from medication and is looking for advice. 

Please Support Our Sponsors:

MagBreakthrough.com/adamdrew

Con-Cret.com/Podcast

BlindsGalore.com let them know we sent you

item.title: #1603 There Was An 'Incident'
item.itunes:title: #1603 There Was An 'Incident'
item.description:
Drew and Mark pickup on their diet discussion from the most recent episode but pivoting slightly to discuss Drew's workout routine and what he's done to recover from his 'incident'. Drew reveals that he has been working out for long periods of time each day with nearly an hour of running and 45 minutes of weights. They also pick up on something Dr. Drew said in a previous show about masks possibly not being effective and they drill down on what that really means in a practical sense for doctors and the public at large. They also review the comments made at a County USC town hall where Paul Holtom was speaking very frankly about his hospital's experience surrounding Covid and potential reinstatement of mask mandates. They also discuss aging and their respective hopes for how long they would like to live.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/Adam2 Con-Cret.com/Podcast BlindsGalore.com let them know we sent you

item.title: #1601 Trust Ami Horowitz
item.itunes:title: #1601 Trust Ami Horowitz
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew welcome Ami Horowitz to this show today and they open the discussion with Adam explaining the premise behind his favorite video of Ami where he inquires with random black people on the streets of NY asking them if they have access to ID. They also discuss Ami's latest work concentrating on the Isralei Palistinian conflict as he explores which of the two groups acts with more concern for innocent lives. They also discuss how Adam's affinity for Jewish people grew during his childhood and how food fostered that love. As the show wraps up Adam pays off his tease of the 'insidious' thought from our most recent episode.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Con-Cret.com/Podcast TenThousand.cc/ADS BlindsGalore.com Let them know we sent you

item.title: #1600 There's a Pool!
item.itunes:title: #1600 There's a Pool!
item.description:
Adam opens up the show talking to Dr. Drew about a NY Post article about inflation he was tweeted and points out what he realized by quickly scrolling through the article and looking at the pictures therein. They also speak with a caller who has a suggestion for modifying the show slightly to aid in his quest to share the show with new listeners who may not be in on some of the long running gags within the show. They also speak to a caller whose wife and daughter both have Covid and are experiencing very different symptoms and is wondering why that is.

item.title: #1599 My Schedule Is Always My Schedule
item.itunes:title: #1599 My Schedule Is Always My Schedule
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show talking about the wild day that Adam has already experienced while trying to manage the crazy schedule of book promotion he is dealing with. They also explore a graph that was tweeted to Adam discussing cases, hospitalizations & deaths as a result of covid across 100,000 Canadians. They also speak to a caller who recently saw an exchange between Senator Josh Hawley & UC Berkeley professor Khiara Bridges debating trans issues during a Senate hearing and wants Adam & Dr. Drew's thoughts.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS Con-Cret.com/Podcast BlindsGalore.com Let them know we sent you!

item.title: #1598 I Created The Behymen, Full Stop!
item.itunes:title: #1598 I Created The Behymen, Full Stop!
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing music as Drew recalls an experience he had recently at a bar in Laguna Beach. Adam goes on to explain some of the things that he has been ignorant about over the years of his life and how he's gone on to actively work to change those things. They also speak to a caller who wants to know if there are any so-called 'woke' terms that they do enjoy. As the show wraps up the guys discuss the changes in language and why people continue to believe politician's words despite their repeated actions.

item.title: #1597 Cisgender White Male Boomer
item.itunes:title: #1597 Cisgender White Male Boomer
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show harkening back to a topic from the last show as they discuss Gavin Newsom's hypocritical travel plans to Montana. They also discuss the hubris behind President Biden's claims that he has never spoken about business with his adult son and a newly unearthed voicemail that seems to indicate otherwise. They also speak to a caller who visited a dermatologist and was prescribed an interesting medication that he has questions about.

item.title: #1596 The Evil Donut Shop
item.itunes:title: #1596 The Evil Donut Shop
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Alex Berenson recently being reinstated to Twitter which quickly leads to his work from years past on marijuana and how his predictions are proving true today. They also discuss Gavin Newsom's proclamations that're now being viewed as wildly hypocritical as he himself publicly ignores them. They also speak to a caller who wants their opinions on Newsom's ads that he ran in Florida. As the show wraps up they cicle back to Alex Berenson's tweet that got him kicked off twitter and discuss the idea of what most people think when they hear 'vaccine' versus what it technically means from a medical standpoint.
Please Support Our Sponsors: MoinkBox.com/ADS Con-Cret.com/Podcast

item.title: #1595 Now Listen To Me!
item.itunes:title: #1595 Now Listen To Me!
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the change in language that has gone on in society with terms like 'offended' giving way to 'affected' and 'enjoy the flight' transforming into 'enjoy your flight'. They also discuss the imperfect nature of memory in terms of the Johnny Depp Amber Heard trial as well as experiments Drew has seen friends implement that demonstrate just how imperfect the human memory is. They also speak to a caller who is curious about the prospect of getting himself a Covid booster shot.

item.title: #1594 You're Not Going To Change HIS Mind
item.itunes:title: #1594 You're Not Going To Change HIS Mind
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing how some movements that started well intentioned are now being somewhat abandoned by people who were previously all in on the message but have started to see some cracks in the foundation. They also explore someone that Adam heard on Dennis Prager's show who has written a piece about how young people are starting to see the societal value in being a member of a protected group which may be leading to more young people transitioning or identifying as something they may not be. They also turn to the phones and speak to a few callers on topics from forgiving student loan debt, and another with a question about abandonment issues.
Please Support Our Sponsors: GetRoman.com/ADS Bonafide.com/ADS GuruNanda.com/Win

item.title: #1593 Legacy
item.itunes:title: #1593 Legacy
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the recent Supreme Court move to overturn Roe and the way that the most protected cities are reacting in the most extreme way. They also discuss the way people's ideas about the topic of abortion have swung hard in both directions since the mid 1990s when it seemed like most people were on board with where we stood on the issue. Adam also discusses an interview he heard on a radio show discussing how transitioning and movements like Black Lives Matter are somewhat linked and they turn to the phones and speak to callers including one wondering about their legacy and another with questions about the continued push to get children vaccinated.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS TrueBill.com/ADS MudWtr.com/ADS

item.title: #1590 Pride is the New Self-Esteem Movement
item.itunes:title: #1590 Pride is the New Self-Esteem Movement
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a recent story that Adam saw where concern is now arising about spraying aerosol sunscreen on people's faces and Adam harkens back to his worries about this as far back as Loveline. They also discuss the current propensity that Americans have to break into groups and feeling a sense of pride simply by being a member of a group and how that is hampering people from accomplishment. They also discuss the idea of being 'fulfilled' by your work and how that isn't what one should be striving for when it comes to employment and how we need to reframe the thinking.
Please Support Our Sponsors: GuruNanda.com/win Babbel.com/ADS

item.itunes:title: #1588 There's a Certain Gene...
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew pick up where they left off on the last show discussing the so-called 'whipping' of Hatian migrants and how it was covered by the media in the immediate aftermath. They also speak to a caller who is looking for clarification on how do tell the difference between addiction and dependancy when it comes to both marijuana and pornography. They also speak to a Chicago resident who wants to tell them about the insanity of having to wear a mask to an orthodontist appointment where his mouth was open for 90% of his visit. They also speak to a caller with a strange name about UFOs.

item.title: #1585 We Need To Monitor This Stuff
item.itunes:title: #1585 We Need To Monitor This Stuff
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the new 'misinformation czar' and the necessity of such a position. They also explore the ways in which such an office can be used as a weapon to control a citizenry. Drew also discusses Adam's recent birthday party where the topic of Covid came up and Drew found himself in some uncomfortable conversations on the topic. They also turn to the phones and speak with a caller who is experiencing apathy and is in need of a little guidance. Adam also explains his comedic talent and how it was a burden that was driving him slowly insane before he finally went all in and made comedy his career.

item.title: #1583 Donate Proceeds to Aqua-Woman
item.itunes:title: #1583 Donate Proceeds to Aqua-Woman
item.description:
Adam laments to Drew on the failures of thick crust pizza and why there is no reason not to get thin crust. A caller asks Adam about his appearance on the Steve Hilton Show a couple of years ago. Adam remembers how smokers were slowly pushed out in small steps that eventually led to just smoking outside on the streets. A caller asks about the best heartburn medication to take in your 50's. Drew gives his take on the Amber Heard/Johnny Depp trial and how certain people can distort their own memories.
Please Support our Sponsors: AltoIRA.com/ADS JustWorks.com Geico.com

Drew gives his take on the Amber Heard/Johnny Depp trial and how certain people can distort their own memories.
Please Support our Sponsors: AltoIRA.com/ADS JustWorks.com Geico.com

item.title: #1580 It's an Outdoor Hospital
item.itunes:title: #1580 It's an Outdoor Hospital
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show reading the long promised and thoroughly insane LA Times op-ed that was released shortly after the tragic school shooting in Parkland Florida. They then turn to the phones and speak to a caller from Nashville who wants to discuss how his city dealt with homelessness as juxtaposed against how LA does it. They also speak to a caller looking for advice on her marriage and Drew talks more about his experience navigating his time in the middle east. As the show wraps up Adam points out an inherent flaw in team mentality.
Please Support Our Sponsors: The Jordan Harbinger Show Lifelock.com promo code ADAM

item.title: #1579 It Can Be Stupid AND Liar
item.itunes:title: #1579 It Can Be Stupid AND Liar
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show continuing to talk about Drew's trip to the Middle East and his experiences interacting with the locals. They also continue their discussion about CNN and their pick and choose reporting, specifically citing the story they didn't report on where the border patrol agents accused of 'whipping' migrants were cleared of any possible criminal charges. Adam also hunts for an old LA Times op-ed after a caller brings up the response to the Texas school shooting and he teases the reveal for our final show this week.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Lifelock.com promo code ADAM Meater.com promo code ADSHOW JustWorks.com GuruNanda.com/Win

item.title: #1578 Data They Didn't Like
item.itunes:title: #1578 Data They Didn't Like
item.description:
Drew joins the show remotely via zoom from an undisclosed location in the Middle East. They discuss his experience traveling and the plane he got to fly on where you don't turn left, for an awesome reason. The conversation then turns to the covid protocols in place while Drew was traveling and some new data finally coming out regarding Covid. Adam also reviews one of his favorite pieces of 'reporting' done by CNN early on in the pandemic and uses that to point out how CNN is picking and choosing on its coverage of mass shootings.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Lifelock.com Promo Code ADAM Meater.com Promo Code ADSHOW SimpliSafe.com/Adam2

item.title: #1576 If You Sleep Outside and You're Not Camping, You're Nuts
item.itunes:title: #1576 If You Sleep Outside and You're Not Camping, You're Nuts
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show picking up right where we left off last episode, reviewing some of Christopher Lowell's glorious late 90s TV show. Adam also shares with Dr. Drew a short video of former Adam Carolla Show guest Dr. Andrew Huberman discussing the benefits of cold water exposure. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who wants Dr. Drew's take on the recent shooting in Buffalo and the shooter's reported statements that he believed he was of sane mind. They also speak with a caller who wants to discuss the idea that Apple asking employees to come to the office is somehow racist and they review some photos of the broken down campers and RVs over taking Los Angeles' streets.
Please Support Our Sponsors: BlindsGalore.com let them know we sent you GuruNanda.com/win The Jordan Harbinger Show

item.title: #1575 The Gayest Man Ever
item.itunes:title: #1575 The Gayest Man Ever
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing some of the things they are experiencing with their bodies as the age with Drew marveling at what he's been able to do and Adam explaining some issues he's been having with his hands. The conversation then turns to the seas as the guys talk about the latest episode of The Love Boat that Adam watched. Adam also discusses the morbid story of racer Rolf Stommelen and the devastating crash he was involved in that resulted in the tragic deaths of several spectators. They also take some phone calls leading them back to fond memories of interior designed Christopher Lowell.

item.itunes:title: #1574 OK, She's Lying
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show by playing back a clip of this show from March 2020 as they attempt to examine the things they were pointing out then that still havent been addressed over two years later. As the show wraps up they turn to the phones and take some listener phone calls.

item.title: #1572 No, It's Lying
item.itunes:title: #1572 No, It's Lying
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the recent trouble that Adam got into with his YouTube account being suspended over comments made about Covid. They explore the fact that while YouTube's standard is to match the WHO hardline and examine the times that the WHO has been wrong or moved the goalposts on what they consider to be fact at the time. They also discuss Stanford professor Jay Bhattacharya and his struggles to attempt to get information out during the Covid pandemic while being stymied by public health officials at every turn - and Adam harkens back to his very early pandemic obsession with ages. They also discuss the extremes that people go to when discussing subjects like Covid and how insane it makes people appear.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Lifelock.com Promo Code ADAM TrueBill.com/ADS AltoIRA.com/ADS BlindsGalore.com SimpliSafe.com/Adam2

item.title: #1571 Fostering Rando Sex
item.itunes:title: #1571 Fostering Rando Sex
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a time during loveline when birth control pills were gaining prominence and the conversations they were having with advocates who were against the use of these pills. They use those conversations as a way of looking at the potential for a reversal of Roe vs. Wade with Drew cautioning that the conversation around fertilized eggs is about to reach a fever pitch. They also turn to the phones and speak to callers on a variety of topics including the potential for another civil war, how movies age in the PC world that we live in and much more.
Please Support Our Sponsors: JustWorks.com Geico.com BlindsGalore.com let them know we sent you

item.title: #1570 Nouveau Dumb Is In Charge
item.itunes:title: #1570 Nouveau Dumb Is In Charge
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the 'good old school dumb' and how it compares to the 'new dumb' that we are experiencing in 2022. Adam goes on to explain how those who went though the college system have gone into governmental service and are not aware that their views are informed by what they were emparted in their college environments. Later they turn to the phones and speak with a caller who feels her life is a mess and is looking for some direction & relationship advice as well as a caller with questions about platelet-rich plasma therapy.
Please Support Our Sponsors: FastGrowingTrees.com/ADS The Jordan Harbinger Show BlindsGalore.com Let them know we sent you

item.title: #1569 Should Be National News
item.itunes:title: #1569 Should Be National News
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show talking about the ongoing lockdowns in China and the insane notion that our initial response to Covid was to follow the exact policies of a communist nation. This leads to an animated rant from Adam about those who may have had the audacity to question portions of those mandates. They also discuss the impending drought restrictions and explore how it is a symptom of a much larger issue with our state government. They also speak to callers including one with questions about kratom, lockdown trauma, especially when it comes to those in recovery and much more.

item.title: #1568 When It's Done
item.itunes:title: #1568 When It's Done
item.description:
Adam opens the show discussing a recent walk he took through his neighborhood with his dog Phil who loves to flop out on stranger's lawns only to have the homeowner come home to find this confusing situation. Adam and Drew also try to drill down on why the areas that they live in are nice, clean and friendly neighborhoods to live in. They also discuss some of their old Loveline guests who had interesting takes on medical conditions with Drew at first incorrectly remembering the name only to have a visceral reaction when Adam found the correct name. They then turn to the phones and speak to a caller looking for advice on dealing with a borderline family member.
Please Support Our Sponsors: GetRoman.com/ADS Lifelock.com Promo Code ADAM The Jordan Harbinger Show

item.itunes:title: #1567 He Shook Hands With a Ghost!
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Drew's recent appearance on Bill Maher's new 'Club Random' podcast and Adam's recent dinner with conservative commentator Ami Horowitz. Adam recounts his conversation with Ami about the viral video that shows Joe Biden becoming confused on a stage or shaking hands with a ghost, depending on your political leanings. They then turn to the phones and speak to a caller who believes he may be suffering from withdrawal from allergy medication and another who recently lost his wife and wants to talk about early cancer detection.

item.title: #1562 Don't We Know That By Now?
item.itunes:title: #1562 Don't We Know That By Now?
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show paying off a tease from our last show where Drew claimed to have pushed back against a school board member who was announcing school closures in March of 2020. Once Adam stops screaming about the buffoonery of the LA School Board & Teachers Union the conversation turns to phones as they speak to a caller who suffers from cystic fibrosis and wants to discuss how covid impacted her life. Adam then turns to the Urban Dictionary to review some of the contributions he has made there over the years. As the show wraps up they turn to the phones and speak to callers on topics from new vaccine options to antibody durability and more.
Thanks For Supporting Today's Sponsors: Babbel.com/ADS Lifelock.com Promo Code ADAM The Jordan Harbinger Show Geico.com Pluto.TV

item.title: #1561 Well, Now I'm Suspicious
item.itunes:title: #1561 Well, Now I'm Suspicious
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Adam's recent interview with neuroscientist Andrew Huberman. They also discuss a recent guest that Drew had on his show who went through a heart transplant as a somewhat young man and discuss the need to find and listen to good sources while being careful to look out for narratives. They also take a trip down memory lane and review some of the exchanges from early in the pandemic to see how they've aged. As the show winds down they turn to the phones and speak to callers of topics from intermittent fasting to crime in LA and more.
Thanks For Supporting Today's Sponsors: FastGrowingTrees.com/ADS TenThousand.cc Promo Code ADS LifeLock.com Promo Code ADAM Geico.com Pluto.TV

item.title: #1560 When Is Reality Going To Creep In
item.itunes:title: #1560 When Is Reality Going To Creep In
item.description: Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Adam's distaste for Hannah Barbara and Sid & Marty Kroft TV programming for children as they fleeced America for many years. The conversation then turns to some of the entertainment they've been consuming, eventually landing on a mutual love of Netflix's 'Formula 1: Drive to Survive' docuseries. Drew then brings up the current lockdowns in Shanghai and marvels at the similarities between that and what was done in Wuhan in 2020 despite the wealth of data we have now that we didn't have then. item.title: #1558 Go Look Up The Word Tamper
item.itunes:title: #1558 Go Look Up The Word Tamper
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing parenting and how some parents may not be able to zoom out and observe that they are actually doing damage by trying to be friendly with their children as opposed to parenting. Drew goes on to discuss his recent obsession with French culture and people and Adam discusses how Americans as of late are scared to speak candidly about their views. They also speak to a caller about an impending medical procedure his child is facing and as the show wraps up Drew asks Adam to float his new 'roommate analogy' that he previously shared with Drew off air.

item.title: #1557 Say Do It
item.itunes:title: #1557 Say Do It
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew expressing his distaste with being rushed in life. Adam expands upon this by talking about his inability to go to sleep early and his desire to satisfy people who have made reasonable requests of him. Adam also recalls some of the behavior he observed when he worked on The Man Show and how it informed his view of people's motivations. Later they turn to the phones and speak with a caller who has thoughts on how narcissism and victim mentality are inherently linked.
Please Support Our Sponsors: MoinkBox.com/ADS UE.com/fits, promo code ADS JustWorks.com BlindsGalore.com, tell them we sent you Pluto.TV

item.title: #1554 Close Enough, with Adam Carolla
item.itunes:title: #1554 Close Enough, with Adam Carolla
item.description:
Adam opens the show talking to Dr. Drew about the early stages of his employment and his distaste with government intervention into those kinds of negotiations. They also discuss the recent news that Bruce Willis is stepping away from acting due to health issues as Drew gives his thoughts on what his family is saying about his illness. Later they turn to the phones and speak with a Culver City resident who wants to discuss the proposal by Culver City Councilmembers to expand an existing homeless encampment by eliminating public parking. As the show winds down they speak to another caller who wants to hear about the guys' relationships with their parents.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS The Jordan Harbinger Show Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM MagBreakthrough.com/ADAMDREW Pluto.TV

item.title: #1553 Zero Tolerance Situation
item.itunes:title: #1553 Zero Tolerance Situation
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the Netflix documentary series 'Bad Vegan' and the psychology behind the people involved. They then turn to the phones and speak to a caller who has thoughts & questions about how this show differs from the original iterations of 'Loveline'. Adam also brings up the new Netflix show 'Is It A Cake?' as he illustrates how he reveres the artistry behind the cakes. They also discuss childhood sexual abuse and the insidious nature of victims turning into perpetrators and how pornography plays into the situation as well.

item.title: #1552 You Are = I Am
item.itunes:title: #1552 You Are = I Am
item.description:
Dr. Drew opens the show explaining to Adam how he has been actively working on improving his French by watching French talk shows on YouTube. They also discuss the prevalence of narcissism in America as Drew explains a thought he came across listening to a French psychoanalyst discuss the topic. Adam then brings up a video from the 2020 Presidential debate, specifically discussing Hunter Biden's laptop which has since been authenticated by the New York Times. They then turn to the phones and speak to callers on topics from muscle relaxers and addiction to Covid booster mandates and more.

item.title: #1551 Please Spare Us Your Presence
item.itunes:title: #1551 Please Spare Us Your Presence
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a recent interaction that Adam had with his daughter and what it caused him to think about society at large, specifically when it comes to children. Drew then shares a video of a German politician 'welcoming' Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to a European summit. Adam then brings up a recent news story regarding Covid and how it has impacted the continent of Africa. Later they turn to the phones and speak to a caller looking for advice on what kind of a hands-on project he can start to broaden his horizons.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Headspace.com/ADS Geico.com Pluto.TV

item.title: #1550 You're Not That, You're Square Man!
item.itunes:title: #1550 You're Not That, You're Square Man!
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the changes in actors cast in roles thought of as the 'heavy' and how their stature has changed over the years. They then turn to the phones and speak to a caller who wants their thoughts on people who wear the wallet chain. They also speak with a caller who has concerns about the psychology surrounding the long term effects of masking children in schools and what the unforeseen byproducts may be. They also discuss the recent Andy Warhol documentary they both viewed and they offer their thoughts on how he was able to fit into a time that maybe wasn't ready for his art. As the show wraps up they speak to a caller who is wondering if Adam has any of the work he created from his time as a ceramics major in high school.
Please Support Our Sponsors: GetRoman.com/ADS Geico.com Magbreakthrough.com/AdamDrew Pluto.TV

item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the bygone age of cigarette companies advertising in confusing places such as athletic competitions, specifically citing the Benson & Hedges Classic from the 1970s. Later they turn to the phones and speak to a caller with a response to a previous caller who had strong thoughts on former President Trump.

item.title: #1547 Magically It Just Ended
item.itunes:title: #1547 Magically It Just Ended
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the pivot in their broadcasting careers that lead to them exploring political policies. The conversation then turns to some remarks made recently by Joe Biden discussing America's oil plans as it relates to Russia's incursion into Ukraine. Adam also presents Dr. Drew with a theory about the relationship between oil producing nations and automobile creating nations. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller with a harrowing childhood story. As the show wraps up they discuss the shift in messaging by California Governor Gavin Newsom when it comes to homelessness.
Please Support Our Sponsors: UE.com/Fits Geico.com Pluto.TV

item.title: #1545 Imagine
item.itunes:title: #1545 Imagine
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the emotional gravity of not having meaning and focus and things to do and accomplish. Adam also recounts the strong push about two decades back to bring music back to schools and points out that even then he was pushing to bring back shop classes. They also review recent remarks made by Vice President Kamala Harris as they carefully examine the language she uses during the remarks. Adam also questions the timing of those remarks as he points out that given the current geopolitical landscape we might be wise to take more of a wartime posture. As the show wraps up they explore some language from the CDC website as well as an NPR article from a few months ago.
Please Support Our Sponsors: MoinkBox.com/ADS Subscribe to The Jordan Harbinger Show Geico.com Pluto.TV

item.title: #1544 He's a Sex Machine
item.itunes:title: #1544 He's a Sex Machine
item.description:
At the top of the show, the guys take a call about tinnitus, and the conversation turns to gas prices, Russia, and MSNBC. Adam then tells Drew about a recent trope he noticed while watching Three's Company reruns on television, which leads to Drew commenting that he hasn't been watching 70s TV for the last ten days or so. In order to catch him up, Adam shows him a particularly disturbing storyline from a 1982 episode of The Love Boat.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Subscribe to The Jordan Harbinger Show Geico.com

item.title: #1543 Vile & Evil
item.itunes:title: #1543 Vile & Evil
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing some of the content and bizarre moments from President Biden's recent State of the Union address. They also discuss the insanity of things that we consider to be big societal problems here at home when viewed against the backdrop of Russia invading in an attempt to take over their neighbors in Ukraine. They also review a clip from a recent episode of 'Real Time with Bill Maher' and use it as a starting point in examining language and how it has evolved, or devolved, in recent years. As the show wraps up we hear about a recent interaction between Adam & his mother.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/ADAM2 Geico.com

item.title: #1541 Crazy Atheist Gypsy People
item.itunes:title: #1541 Crazy Atheist Gypsy People
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Adam's mom as Drew is surprised to learn that she had a period of her life where she did a lot of international travel on the cheap. They also speak with a caller who wants to discuss how we, as a society, can combat the startling rise in narcissism that we are experiencing. As the show wraps up Dr. Drew gets fired up about centralization vs decentralization.

item.title: #1540 Outrage Fatigue
item.itunes:title: #1540 Outrage Fatigue
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Three's Company as Adam highlights to Dr. Drew how the show's opening changed from the early seasons to the later ones. They also examine the factual nature of Amazon Prime's 'Being The Ricardos' claiming that at the peak, 'I Love Lucy' was watched by 60 million people. They also speak to a caller who has a new idea for how to signal without wearing a mask that you are a covid ally. They also speak with a caller who has thoughts on the lack of personal responsibility possibly being the common denominator for society's ills.

item.title: #1539 That's Still The World We Live In
item.itunes:title: #1539 That's Still The World We Live In
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show talking about the recent incursion by Russia into Ukraine. As they marvel at the fact that tanks, invented over 100 years ago are rolling into a modern country in 2022. Adam also outlines the insane instincts lately from governments around the world to simply do the opposite for the sake of doing the opposite. They then turn to the phones and speak with a variety of callers including one who snuck into a show in the past.

item.title: #1537 People Want To Get Back To Living
item.itunes:title: #1537 People Want To Get Back To Living
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Drew's recent trip to Culver City and his astonishment at the state of things as simple as the public roadways. They also turn to the phones and speak to a caller who is a recovering alcoholic and wants Drew's take on what we should expect when the next virus comes our way. Adam also disgusts Dr. Drew with his favorite recent clip of Los Angeles County Department of Public Health Director Barbara Ferrer explaining how she isn't ready to give up and let people die. As the show wraps up the guys turn back to the phones and speak to a caller with questions about marijuana and another who is wondering when she can expect a negative covid test.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/ADAM2 TenThousand.cc/ADS Babbel.com/ADS Geico.com Pluto.TV

item.title: #1536 What Happened to Rebelliousness?
item.itunes:title: #1536 What Happened to Rebelliousness?
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a recent comment by Scott Adams before transitioning into a conversation about Adam's 'Crate Training' theory as it applies to America's youth. Adam goes on to recount an interaction he had recently with his kids' school nurse that he believes could get him dubbed 'World's Worst Father'. As the show wraps up the guys get fired up about some of the ridiculous behavior on display at the Super Bowl where no one, including the Mayor of LA, wore masks despite mandates and pleas from officials.

item.title: #1534 I Support The Right To Say Whatever You Want
item.itunes:title: #1534 I Support The Right To Say Whatever You Want
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the dichotomy between people who are very concerned with the environment but are also unwilling to use anything but renewable energy and the consequences of such a stance. They also discuss the frequent reports of 'misinformation' and how those labeling things as such as also the arbiters of what constitutes 'misinformation' in the first place. They also speak to a caller with thoughts on the 'Washington Wives' organization from the 1980s and how their message would be viewed today.

item.title: #1532 Florida Followed Sweden, California Followed China
item.itunes:title: #1532 Florida Followed Sweden, California Followed China
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing lockdowns and restrictions surrounding covid and how they will apply to the Super Bowl coming next weekend to Los Angeles' SoFi Stadium. They also turn to the phones and speak with a caller who is managing women's OnlyFans accounts and is looking for advice on navigating the situation. Adam also harkens back to a funny clip from May 2020 where a Long Island official is giving guidance on safe use of tennis courts. As the show wraps up they speak with a caller who credits Adam with inspiring Joe Rogan to start podcasting and wants to know if Adam has considered what that means for his place in history.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Evite.com/ADS Jordan Harbinger Show Blocktraffik.org Geico.com

Please Support Our Sponsors: Evite.com/ADS Jordan Harbinger Show Blocktraffik.org Geico.com

item.title: #1531 You're Ashamed Of Your Cowardice, Now Go Live With It
item.itunes:title: #1531 You're Ashamed Of Your Cowardice, Now Go Live With It
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the 'stepping down' of Jeff Zucker from CNN and what the reality of that story might be as opposed to the narrative that CNN itself is painting. They also discuss the impending Super Bowl being hosted at SoFi Stadium in Los Angeles and the mask mandate coming with it, as they try to explore what other stadiums have similar mandates in place. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who wants to discuss and expand upon Adam's 'death of math' theory. They also talk to a caller who recently experienced a heightened level of wokeness he wants to discuss.

item.title: #1530 Craig Greiwe for LA Mayor
item.itunes:title: #1530 Craig Greiwe for LA Mayor
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing 'guillotine culture' as it relates to the treatment of people like Rosanne Barr as opposed to Whoopi Goldberg. They then welcome their guest Craig Greiwe who is running for mayor of Los Angeles and has some new ideas for what the city needs. After Craig departs, Adam and Drew rail against some of the comments made by current LA Mayor Eric Garcetti after he was photographed maskless next to Magic Johnson at an NFL Game and highlight comments made by a SoFi Stadium employee about the coming Super Bowl game.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS Con-Cret.com/podcast Geico.com
