item.title: #1529 The Ones Who Care The Least, Do The Best
item.itunes:title: #1529 The Ones Who Care The Least, Do The Best
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing some tweets that Dr. Drew saw imploring them to talk more about the 1970s, leading to a conversation on hair styles. They also discuss the 'forgotten combover' that was Johnny Carson. Later they turn to the phones and speak to a caller with thoughts on President Biden's pledge to nominate an African American woman to the Supreme Court. They also speak to a caller out of Seattle who recently had a mask confrontation that he wants to tell the guys about.

item.title: #1528 It Seems A Theme To Me
item.itunes:title: #1528 It Seems A Theme To Me
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show harkening back to the 1970s and remembering a product from their childhoods called the 'Pocket Fisherman'. They also examine the instinct that exists in many people to default to a 'what's in it for me' mentality and how damaging that is to the people with that attitude. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who is perplexed by a past failed relationship that still vexes him to this day and is looking for some insight. They also speak to a caller who has suffered from all three variants of Covid and was surprised that Omicron hit him hardest.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Jordan Harbinger Show TenThousand.CC, code ADS JustWorks.com Geico.com

item.title: #1527 Don't Label Things 'Misinformation', Label It 'Disagrees With Us'
item.itunes:title: #1527 Don't Label Things 'Misinformation', Label It 'Disagrees With Us'
item.description:
Dr. Drew opens the show telling Adam about his ongoing battle with and plan to surgically remove his diverticulitis. Adam also asks Drew for an update on monoclonal antibodies and Adam observes some disturbing themes that have arisen during the rise of the Omicron variant. Adam also highlights an article from Alex Berenson and points out many of the observations he has been seeing as the pandemic unfolds.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Headspace.com/ADS 1800Flowers.com, code ADS Con-Cret.com/podcast FightCamp.com/ADS

item.title: #1526 I Needed To Know What It Was Doing There
item.itunes:title: #1526 I Needed To Know What It Was Doing There
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew pitching Adam on the idea of making an Adam Carolla bobblehead toy to match his own (for sale now at drdrew.com). Adam also discusses diversity and the possible byproducts of ending up with Kamala Harris as President simply because Joe Biden wanted a woman of color on the ticket. They then speak to a caller who has found a real medical syndrome that bears a striking resemblance to Restless Cock Syndrome, also known as RCS. Later they spend some time discussing The Love Boat before going back to the phones to speak to a caller who is concerned about a swollen lymph node on the heels of a Covid booster shot.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Jordan Harbinger Show TenThousand.CC, code ADS SugarBreak.com/ADS, code ADS

item.title: #1525 Just Say What You're Doing
item.itunes:title: #1525 Just Say What You're Doing
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show talking about CNN's abysmal ratings that some report have dropped by as much as 90%. They also discuss the news that Discovery Channel is reportedly going to buy CNN and what changes may come as a result of that deal. Adam also rants about Vice President Harris' refusal to answer even the most basic questions and how crazy we've gotten when it comes to vaccines in regards to kids specifically. Adam also play a clip of him reacting to Dr. Fauci from last September and discuss the current state of effective therapeutics and why they are nearly impossible to procure.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/ADAM2 Babbel.com/ADS Geico.com

item.title: #1523 Vinnie Tortorich: Beyond Impossible
item.itunes:title: #1523 Vinnie Tortorich: Beyond Impossible
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew welcome returning guest and good friend of the show Vinnie Tortorich who has a new film 'Beyond Impossible' exploring the world of plant-based meat replacement products. They also have some maddening conversations over the virtues of eating eggs and marvel at the fact that in 2022 this is still a conversation that needs to be had. After Vinnie departs Adam and Dr. Drew have a long talk about how fortunate they feel to have found his methods and how frustrating it is that the health officials in our governments are not advocating for these methods as well. As the show wraps up they take a few more listener phone calls on a variety of topics.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Overland.com/ADS Geico.com

item.title: SNEAK PREVIEW: Introducing "Fly on the Wall with Dana Carvey and David Spade"
item.itunes:title: SNEAK PREVIEW: Introducing "Fly on the Wall with Dana Carvey and David Spade"
item.description: Be a “Fly on the Wall” as Saturday Night Live alumni Dana Carvey and David Spade take you behind the scenes to reminisce about the most memorable stories and moments with friends of the show. In each episode, you’ll hear from your favorite cast members, hosts, writers, and musical guests as they share never-before told stories about their careers; including how they made their way to the show and how being a part SNL’s cultural history has impacted their lives beyond the show. Fly on the Wall with Dana Carvey and David Spade is a presentation of Cadence13.

item.title: #1522 I'm So Glad I'm Not Everyone Else
item.itunes:title: #1522 I'm So Glad I'm Not Everyone Else
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing how bureaucracy is really one of the biggest problems we are dealing with. They also touch on recent rumors that Pete Davidson might be hosting The Oscars before turning to the phones and speaking with a caller from Germany who recently had close contact with a now positive Covid case. They also speak to a caller who wants to discuss the number of cases of European footballers collapsing mid-game and how it may relate to the Covid vaccine.

item.title: #1521 It Couldn't Have Been Done Without The Pussies
item.itunes:title: #1521 It Couldn't Have Been Done Without The Pussies
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing cannabis addiction and how it is largely written off by many in the media. They also discuss Adam's interview with Scott Baio who used to be able to work as a republican in Hollywood and how he's seen that change. We then touch briefly on The Love Boat and pay off the Jimmy Carter clip we were looking for in our last show. They also review an article written by an Isreali immunologist who is highly critical of the Covid response. As the show wraps up the guys go back in time and review some of their tweets from earlier in the pandemic to see how they've aged.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS Geico.com

item.title: #1520 Write That Down!
item.itunes:title: #1520 Write That Down!
item.description:
Today's show opens with a continued conversation about group memory. Adam then reflects on a Jimmy Carter documentary he was watching, and the way the media has started to lift up Carter's image after comparisons began getting made to President Biden. From there the guys take calls about withdrawal, adultery, and water cremation. As the show wraps up, Adam and Drew speak with one last caller about the successful insurrection in Egypt back in 2011.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SugarBreak.com/ADS Evite.com/ADS Geico.com Blocktraffik.org

item.title: #1519 Once You Pick a Side, You Go Hard
item.itunes:title: #1519 Once You Pick a Side, You Go Hard
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with a very frustrated Adam explaining to Drew a recent frustrating interaction that he had on his show where Bryan, Gina & Dawson were teaming up on Adam trying to convince him he was wrong when he wasn't. This leads to a larger conversation about psychology and how quickly a group of people can form a team and become certain. They then turn to the phones and speak to a caller who is younger and considering a vasectomy and looking for advice.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/ADAM2 Con-Cret.com/podcast Geico.com

item.title: #1518 You Can Talk People Into Feeling a Certain Way
item.itunes:title: #1518 You Can Talk People Into Feeling a Certain Way
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew telling Adam about the familiar symptoms that he's been dealing with after becoming infected with Covid a second time. They also discuss a clip of President Biden from July explaining that some with 'Long Covid' may be eligible for disability payments to cover their needs. As the show wraps up Drew tells Adam about a listener email he was sent challenging them to call out our news outlets more equally when they are dishonest.
Please Support Our Sponsors: MoinkBox.com/ADS Con-Cret.com/podcast Geico.com

item.title: #1517 Mass Formation Psychosis
item.itunes:title: #1517 Mass Formation Psychosis
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Adam sharing a few commercials he has seen with similar themes. Drew also talks to Adam about Dr. Malone's recent interview with Joe Rogan and what his takeaways were from observing that interview. They then turn to the phones and speak to a caller whose teenage daughter is getting requests from peers to send nudes and is looking for advice. Adam also laments his inability to get those around him to follow basic logic when it comes to washing dishes (and more).
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/ADAM2 Geico.com Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM Magbreakthrough.com/ADAMDREW

item.title: #1515 As Sanity Comes Into View...
item.itunes:title: #1515 As Sanity Comes Into View...
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Drew's second bout with Covid that went through his whole family and what their experience was like. Adam also opines on why he hasn't come down with the disease despite many around him becoming infected. They also explore the role that the media or '4th Estate' has been complicit in spreading bad information and needs a revolution as soon as possible.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS Headspace.com/ADS TrueBill.com/ADS Con-Cret.com/podcast Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.title: BEST OF #1269 Death of Math, Judgement & Judging (originally aired May 2020)
item.itunes:title: BEST OF #1269 Death of Math, Judgement & Judging (originally aired May 2020)
item.description:
Adam and Drew open the show continuing their discussion about death, the death of math and the death of facts. They also discuss the built in 'fear gear' that humans have built into themselves as a means of self preservation and how the current state of news media is over exercising that gear to an extreme degree leading to much more fear. They also examine a new PSA that was put out by HBO regarding the pandemic and give their thoughts on why they consider it a terrible and possibly even dangerous message.
THANKS TO TODAY'S SPONSORS: SimpliSafe.com/ADAM2 Geico.com

item.title: BEST OF #1268 They Might Let You Do That (originally aired May 2020)
item.itunes:title: BEST OF #1268 They Might Let You Do That (originally aired May 2020)
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew recalling a recent conversation he had with their mutual friend Mark Geragos who is attempting to sue the city and the state of California for government overreaching. Adam then discusses an email he got from one of his representatives and the misleading language used therein. As the show winds up, Adam brings the conversation to a recent guest from The Adam Carolla Show, Dr. David Katz and what he had to say on the topics of nursing homes and the coronavirus pandemic.
Thanks to today's sponsors: Con-cret.com/podcast Geico.com

item.title: #1514 I Don't Give Advice About Things
item.itunes:title: #1514 I Don't Give Advice About Things
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Adam's habits of consuming media. They also discuss Adam's parenting methods and some of the things he has noticed in other parents as he attends her volleyball games. After a brief Love Boat detour they turn to the phones and speak with a caller who wants Dr. Drew's thoughts on the new therapeutics coming to combat Covid as he tries to avoid a vaccine booster. They wrap up the show by marveling at the 1960s sitcom 'The Flying Nun'.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Subscribe to The Jordan Harbinger Show

item.title: #1513 What's Wrong With Some Positivity?
item.itunes:title: #1513 What's Wrong With Some Positivity?
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew breaking down the information we have today as he understands it regarding the new Omicron Covid variant. They also discuss their confusion surrounding the leaders who seem to love controlling the public as well as the subset of society that seem to enjoy going along with it. Adam also harkens back to a classic CNN clip from April 2020 as they explore how it's aged. As the show winds down they turn to the phones and speak to a caller considering homeschooling, and another about the impending closing of a Southern California nuclear power plant.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS JustWorks.com

item.title: #1512 In The Name of Health
item.itunes:title: #1512 In The Name of Health
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show harkening back to their youth as a result of Dr. Drew observing a TV guide in the studio from 1980. This leads to a larger examination as to what was considered 'healthy' at that time by Adam's mom and many others advocating for limiting egg consumption while promoting things like brown sugar. Drew brings it back to the TV Guide as he marvels at how much it transports him back to that time period. They also speak to an Australian listener who calls in to report on the Covid insanity going on in her neck of the woods.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Con-Cret.com/podcast TrueBill.com/ADS

item.title: #1511 They're Jingling Keys
item.itunes:title: #1511 They're Jingling Keys
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing their omnipresent idea of 'chick think' including as it pertains to NYC's new safe injection sites and California's plan to become a 'sanctuary state' for abortions. They also speak to a caller who believes that Dr. Drew has been 'soft' on Covid and wants to know what motivations are behind that approach. Drew also tells Adam about some of famed psychologist Jean Piaget's theory of cognitive development and how it seems to be veering off track in today's society. As the show wraps up the watch a clip of CNN from last year and see how it's aged.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/ADAM2 Overland.com/ADS Babbel.com, promo code ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.title: #1510 This Time It'll Be Different
item.itunes:title: #1510 This Time It'll Be Different
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew come out of the gate hot with some Love Boat talk and review some game film on the subject leading to the advice of one Jesus Christ. Adam also marvels at the amount of ex-wife and alimony jokes that were pervasive in comedy writing at the time. They also go on a deep dive on the musical stylings of Mac Davis and explore just how much hasn't changed from when he was observing the world some 50 years ago. As the show wraps up they speak with a caller who is concerned about some behavior developing with her teenage son that Drew says sounds a lot like Obsessive Compulsive Disorder to him.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Headspace.com/ADS TommyJohn.com/ADS JoinFightCamp.com/ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.title: #1509 We Live In A Post Factual World
item.itunes:title: #1509 We Live In A Post Factual World
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew revealing one of the aesthetics to watch in 2021 and how it related closely to our response to Covid. As they continue to discuss the response to Covid, specifically in California and how it's impacting Adam's children at their school. Drew also marvels at the religious nature surrounding mask wearing in California and breaks down the news surrounding the new variant and how the media has been reacting. Drew harkens back to the development of the AIDS epidemic and recounts some of the mistakes that were made but still can be viewed logically and how that differs from Covid. As the show wraps up they speak with a caller who is working for the US Census and wants their opinions.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Subscribe to The Jordan Harbinger Show Con-Cret.com/podcast MoinkBox.com/ADS TalkSpace.com, promo code ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.description:

They also speak to a caller who has thoughts about Anthony Fauci today as viewed through the lens of his past work on the AIDS epidemic. They also discuss the current situation in California and express some hope that the tide is possibly turning despite wide swaths of the population still being happily crate trained

item.title: #1507 From Highly Educated to Highly Indoctrinated
item.itunes:title: #1507 From Highly Educated to Highly Indoctrinated
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing pitching projects to people around Hollywood and how that has changed in the recent past as well as Dr. Drew's recent lethargy and what might be behind it. Drew also asks Adam for his thoughts on aging as it's a subject that he's been thinking about a lot lately. They then turn to the phones and speak to a caller with questions about vaccinating kids & the booster as well as a caller who has noticed a new 'disclaimer' phenomenon spreading across tv shows and movies. As the show wraps up they speak to a caller with questions about the variants and how they're being portrayed in the media.

item.title: #1506 What're You Gonna Do, Fire Me?
item.itunes:title: #1506 What're You Gonna Do, Fire Me?
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show talking about a recent word brought up on Adam's 'Truth Yeller' comedy special: Tiki. This leads to a larger conversation about 'leisure culture' and how that has morphed in our society as time moves forward. They also discuss Dr. Oz getting into politics and some of the 'protection' certain politicians feel they have leading them to say and do vexing and confusing things. Adam then shares a clip from a recent CNN Coronavirus Townhall leading to a rant of epic proportions and a deep conversation between Adam and Drew about what the 'news' has become.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Subscribe to The Jordan Harbinger Show Cameo.com/ADS Con-Cret.com/podcast Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.title: #1505 The Supremacy of the State
item.itunes:title: #1505 The Supremacy of the State
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with a broad discussion about the reach of the media and how the fight is portrayed by the media as opposed to how it exists in reality. They also hear from a caller out of Brooklyn who was surprised when he went to get a burrito and was forced to produce not just his vaccine card but also his picture ID. As the show wraps up Adam explains to Drew the concept that he is fighting that our government's ultimate goal of control and they review some of Whoopi Goldberg's comments on the Kyle Rittenhouse case.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS Overland.com/ADS For Paint Your Life, text ADS to 64000 LiveXLive.com/ADAMandDREW

item.title: #1504 They're Looking For Equal Justice...For Their Hog
item.itunes:title: #1504 They're Looking For Equal Justice...For Their Hog
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show exploring in detail the lyrics and ideas behind one of John Lennon's biggest hits and what the reality of his lyrics would look like if applied to the practical world. This leads to a conversation about the differences between 'takers' and 'makers' and how they function in our society. Turning to the phones next they speak to a caller wondering if we may be able to harken back to days of yore with some Adam & Drew animations. They also speak to a caller whose mother had an adverse reaction to the monoclonal antibodies and suffered a bad reaction.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Cameo.com/ADS TenThousand.CC, promo code ADS GetRoman.com/ADS LiveXLive.com/ADAMandDREW

item.title: #1503 I've Seen This Movie Before
item.itunes:title: #1503 I've Seen This Movie Before
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew recounting the realization he had when he drove through Laurel Canyon recently and how it led him to realize that he's seen this kind of thing before. Adam also recalls a recent interview he did and the stark differences that he is observing in which side of the aisle is interested in protecting which rights of citizens. They then turn to the phones and speak to a caller who is suffering from a recurrence of tinnitus and is wondering if it's Covid related. They also speak to a returning caller who works in law enforcement in San Francisco for an update on the state of affairs in his city and finally a caller with a theory on why Africa has done so well with Covid despite a low vaccination rate.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/ADAM2 Con-Cret.com/podcast TrueBill.com/ADS TalkSpace.com, promo code ADS LiveXLive.com/ADAMandDREW

item.title: #1502 I'm A Pre-Ignorer
item.itunes:title: #1502 I'm A Pre-Ignorer
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing their mutual love of 'Love Boat' and the Thanksgiving themed episode that has recently aired in honor of the holiday season. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who has been noticing a shift in language where things are becoming less precise. They also speak with an international caller who is interested in getting married and starting a family despite being single and looking for advice. They also speak with a few different callers with specific vaccine concerns looking for advice.

item.title: #1501 Marathons Are Racist
item.itunes:title: #1501 Marathons Are Racist
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show by harkening back to our last episode and the 'Oscar' insurance commercial we were reviewing in that show. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who wants to tell the guys about a pandemic summit held suspiciously close to the start of the Covid-19 outbreak starting and get the guys thoughts. They also speak with a caller who has been experimenting with psyllium husk and has hated the taste and is looking for an alternative. As the show wraps up the speak to a caller with concerns about variants developing and what to be on the lookout for.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.title: #1500 It's All In Your Actions
item.itunes:title: #1500 It's All In Your Actions
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew recounting a recent trip he took to Illinois to speak to a conference of urologists and some of the behavior he experienced in the very blue city of Chicago. Drew also expresses his growing frustrations with the CDC and specifically director Rochelle Walensky's recent misleading comments on the efficacy of masks in the interest of the greater good. The guys then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who wants their thoughts on the minimum wage, leading to a much larger conversation on that topic and economics generally.
Please Support Our Sponsors: BlindsGalore.com, tell them we sent you Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.title: #1499 Masks Are Super Important... Here's Some Fiesta Mix
item.itunes:title: #1499 Masks Are Super Important... Here's Some Fiesta Mix
item.description:
Today- Adam and Drew talk about international travel during these crazy COVID times. The guys then talk about vaccination mandates in Los Angeles, and the announcement that LA may continue face masks policies through 2023. From there, the guys take a call about our elderly leaders making short-sighted decisions, and Adam wonders where all the data is going. As the show wraps up, the guys take one more call about high levels of 'estrone serum' in men.
Please support our sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS GetRoman.com/ADS BlindsGalore.com, tell them we sent you Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.title: #1498 Maybe He's Just Operating A Crane
item.itunes:title: #1498 Maybe He's Just Operating A Crane
item.description:
At the top of the show, Adam and Dr. Drew continue their conversation about Gavin Newsom disappearing from the public eye, and possibly having an adverse reaction to the latest vaccine booster. Drew then complains about our current leadership thinking we can't handle the truth, and the show wraps with listener calls about immunity, COVID predictions for the future, and why you should be using birth control if you don't want to get your girlfriend pregnant.

item.title: #1497 Where In The World is Gavin Sandiego?
item.itunes:title: #1497 Where In The World is Gavin Sandiego?
item.description:
At the top of the show, Dr. Drew floats a theory to Adam about the Love Boat era, and actresses aging out of their 'glamour' days. They go on to discuss the impact of cinema on the way people dress and speak, as well as other anthropological lessons you can learn from past pop culture. Drew also tells Adam about his deep dive on the old show, 'Mr. Ed', and the show wraps up with a conversation about Gavin Newsom's absence from the public eye.
Please support our sponsors: Subscribe to The Jordan Harbinger Show MoinkBox.com/ADS Overland.com/ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.title: #1496 Drew Orleans
item.itunes:title: #1496 Drew Orleans
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with a topic from the very end of the last show, the newfound ability of Twitter being able to silence a fake news shit storm that starts on TV. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who wants their thoughts on the trial of Kyle Rittenhouse and what they see as the likely outcome of that trial. They also speak to a caller with a question about the J&J vaccine and if a booster is warranted at the moment. Next Drew recounts his trip to New Orleans where he hung out with Joe Rogan, Jeff Ross, Dave Chappelle and many more. Drew reveals that he has been invited on The Joe Rogan Experience and gives some insights on his interactions with Dave Chappelle.
Please Support Our Sponsors: CandidCO.com/ADS enter ADS JoinFightCamp.com/ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM For PaintYourLife text ADS to 64-000

item.title: #1495 Outdoor Defying
item.itunes:title: #1495 Outdoor Defying
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show by going straight to the phones and talking to a caller from Utah who is confounded by the constant messaging about masks. As the conversation progresses the topic shifts slightly to include both outdoor dining and vaccine mandates for children. They also speak to a caller from Florida who recently got covid and wants to share his experience of obtaining the monoclonal antibodies. After an impassioned rant about defiance specifically when it comes to California, Drew shares a conversation he had with a Governor who was concerned that a mask mandate he was being encouraged to enact was not his place as a Governor. As the show wraps up, they speak with a caller whose wife was recently diagnosed with cancer and is looking for advice.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS BlindsGalore.com let them know we sent you TryFirstLeaf.com/ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.title: #1494 Read My Description To Me
item.itunes:title: #1494 Read My Description To Me
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Adam recounting his shows this past weekend at the Brea Improv, the first two of six comedy specials that Adam is creating. Adam and Drew also review some of the frustration involved in creating one of the photo based comedy bits that he wanted to use in the special. Drew also notices a slight deviation in Adam's behavior and Adam chastises him for bringing it up on the air. As the show winds down Adam explains to Drew his experience trying to accomplish things that appear wildly doable but it turns out isn't possible for Adam unless he does all the work himself.
Please Support Our Sponsors: XchairDREW.com BlindsGalore.com let them know we sent you TalkSpace.com promo code ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM Subscribe to The Jordan Harbinger Show

item.title: #1493 I Like Soft Serve Yogurt
item.itunes:title: #1493 I Like Soft Serve Yogurt
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the recent controversy surrounding Dave Chappelle and Drew's delight that despite that he is still able to tour and fill arenas. Before turning to the phones, Adam pays off a tease from the last show and plays a clip of Chicago mayor Lori Lightfoot addressing the controversy surrounding her getting a haircut mid-pandemic. Upon getting to the phones they are met by a caller who is unvaccinated and facing a 40% jump in his insurance costs as a result. They also discuss the Alec Baldwin tragedy and speak to a caller who is still struggling after a breakup and looking for advice.
Please Support Our Sponsors: XChairDrew.com GetRoman.com/ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM LiveXLive.com/ADAMandDREW

item.title: #1492 What's Dangerous About My Opinion?
item.itunes:title: #1492 What's Dangerous About My Opinion?
item.description:
Drew opens the show continuing with his reaction to the call we took on Monday in his assessment of the Covid-19 situation and the patterns he has observed. They also discuss the difference in behavior between those who have power and those who feel 'empowered'. Later they turn to the phones and speak to a caller who wants their thoughts on the National Anthem leading Adam to an epic rant on the subject, they also speak with a caller who has previously had Covid and is looking for Dr. Drew's advice on how to best monitor his levels of protection from a second infection.
Please Support Our Sponsors: JustWorks.com TenThousand.cc, code ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM LiveXLive.com/ADAMandDREW

item.title: #1491 When Smart People Act Stupid, They Lie
item.itunes:title: #1491 When Smart People Act Stupid, They Lie
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew telling Adam about the woes of his recent travels including a flight turned around as well his Halloween experience in New Orleans. He also describes some unruly airport behavior leading Adam to ask a larger question about behavior that people are willing to engage in today as opposed to historically. They then turn to the phones as a nurse practitioner calls in to discuss with Drew how medical professionals are trained today.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimplSafe.com/ADAM2 Subscribe to The Jordan Harbinger Show Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM BlockTraffik.org

item.title: #1490 That's Not My Americana
item.itunes:title: #1490 That's Not My Americana
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Adam replaying a clip from a 1982 Love Boat episode as he becomes obsessed with the timeline of the dialogue. They go on to explore the majesty of Ethel Merman and her singing on the show. They also discuss the days of band leaders and true musicians and how they compare to artists like DJ Kahled and Steve Aoki. They then turn back to the phones and speak to a parent whose child has been institutionalized and is extremely distraught.
Please Support Our Sponsors: GetRoman.com/ADS ZipRecruiter.com/ADS LiveXLive.com/ADAMDREW

item.title: #1489 You Made A Mistake, Now Correct It
item.itunes:title: #1489 You Made A Mistake, Now Correct It
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the breaking news that many children's groups have declared an emergency in children's mental health with Drew simultaneously being happy with the news and disgusted with how long it took. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who is caught in the system and feeling helpless. The also speak with a caller interested in Drew's experience with marijuana use disorder and more.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS Miro.com/ADS LiveXLive.com/ADAMDREW

item.title: #1488 Truth Is Starting To Creep In
item.itunes:title: #1488 Truth Is Starting To Creep In
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Drew asking a question and Adam breaking down the different kinds of people that enter a recording studio and the different ways they react to stimuli. They also discuss the passing of Colin Powell and how that is being reported by various outlets. They then turn to the phones and speak to a fellow doctor to talk about the psychiatric definition of delusion. As the show wraps up they review a startling clip from The Today Show regarding Covid spread at college football games.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Overland.com/ADS TalkSpace.com, promo code ADS LiveXLive.com/ADAMDREW

item.itunes:title: #1487 A Glitch In The System
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing the idea of viral headlines and the overwhelming frequency of them being blatantly incorrect or at best misleading. Drew also brings up Dave Chappelle's new special 'The Closer' and the controversy surrounding the subject matter. item.title: #1486 More Safe Spaces & More Octagons
item.itunes:title: #1486 More Safe Spaces & More Octagons
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Adam asking Drew about a rash that has been developing on his forearm that he's trying to figure out that Drew surmises might be poison oak. The conversation then turns to politics as Dr. Drew attempts to explore the phenomenon of cycles in our political system. The conversation then turns to Sanjay Gupta's recent appearance on The Joe Rogan Experience where he was measured and reasonable only to go on Don Lemons' show a short time later and revert back to obfuscating the truth.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS Babbel.com, promo code ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.title: #1485 Jillian Michaels
item.itunes:title: #1485 Jillian Michaels
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew welcome fitness expert and businesswoman Jillian Michaels to the show and they open the show discussing the general idea of how to live in a healthy manner. They also go through Jillian's standard breakfast, lunch and dinner habits as well as her feelings on substituting treats for slightly more healthy options. They also discuss Jillian's experiences as a gay woman and the recent controversy surrounding Dave Chapelle's recent Netflix special. As the show wraps up they discuss 'safe spaces' and how we should be redefining what they look like.
Please Support Our Sponsors: MoinkBox.com/ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.description:

item.title: #1480 It's Wild Incompetence?
item.itunes:title: #1480 It's Wild Incompetence?
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Adam paying off a tease from the last show about a TV commercial Gavin Newsom ran at the end of his recall election and the wild incompetence it highlights. Drew also harkens back to the ride home from Gina Grad's wedding and gets Adam's take on his experience of the conversations had on that ride. They then turn to the phones and speak to a variety of callers including one who has Covid and is looking for treatment advice and another who wants to thank the guys for the impact they've had on his life.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/ADAM2 BlindsGalore.com, tell them Adam sent you Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM

item.itunes:title: #1479 This is a Crate Training
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show harkening back to their childhoods as they review some of the entertainment options that were available to them. As the show wraps up Adam rants about the different behavior in crowds at football stadiums depending on what state they are located in.

item.title: #1478 No Predators in the Wild
item.itunes:title: #1478 No Predators in the Wild
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show by going straight to the phones and speaking to a caller from last week who gives them an update on the various Covid policies he has experienced at various football games. They also speak with a caller with questions about the 'HI GUY' greeting and thanks for the years of entertainment. Adam also shows Drew a video of San Francisco's mayor responding to a video of her partying without a mask coming out despite her city's mandates. As the show wraps up Dr. Drew takes it back to an old familiar place, The Love Boat.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS ZipRecruiter.com/ADS

item.title: #1475 It's Called Character
item.itunes:title: #1475 It's Called Character
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show by going straight to the phones to speak to a self identified 'scientific person' who is very concerned that no one in mainstream media will publicly talk about natural immunity. After Adam stops yelling about that subject, they move on to another caller who works in the ICU and wants to hear Drew's thoughts on the exodus from the nursing profession she is witnessing. As the show wraps up Adam plays a clip of President Biden stumping for Gavin Newsom in his recall election as he points out the talking points the President chose to focus on.
Please Support Our Sponsors: Babbel.com, promo code ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM Pluto TV

item.title: #1474 They're Not Scared, Just Like Your Dog's Not Scared
item.itunes:title: #1474 They're Not Scared, Just Like Your Dog's Not Scared
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show with Adam floating a theory that he's been developing as it pertains to Covid and how people are reacting to the topic. Drew agrees with Adam's theory and the conversation pivots to the importance of exposure and the innate ability for humans to get used to pretty much anything and how that can apply in both positive and negative ways. They then turn to the phones and speak with a variety of callers who want to discuss topics ranging from the 9/11/01 episode of Loveline to a possible connection between affluence and covid behavior and more.
Please Support Our Sponsors: MintMobile.com/ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM Pluto TV

item.title: #1473 Vive La Liberte
item.itunes:title: #1473 Vive La Liberte
item.description:
Adam welcomes Dr. Drew from New York and they discuss the observations Drew made in his European travels regarding Covid. They also discuss the seeming decline in the amount of Delta cases before reviewing a clip of Dr. Fauci talking to Sanjay Gupta about natural immunity and how it compares to vaccines. As the show wraps up Dr. Drew gives Adam his analysis of the video including where he thinks the logic exists and where he doesn't.

item.itunes:title: #1470 The McGinley Theorem

item.title: #1469 Fairytale Fix
item.itunes:title: #1469 Fairytale Fix
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing a recent article that Drew sent to Adam titled 'The Rise of Gyno-Fascism' and a spirited conversation ensues. They then turn to the phones and speak with a caller who is looking for Drew's thoughts on hormone replacement after a hysterectomy and another caller who is covid vaccine hesitant but has employer mandates looming. Adam also discovers a new variation on his famous 'stupid or liar' theory that he explains to Dr. Drew. As the show wraps up Adam and Drew turn back to the phones and speak to a caller out of Texas who wants to discuss people behaving irrationally.
Please Support Our Sponsors: SimpliSafe.com/ADAM2 Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM Pluto TV

item.title: #1468 Just Keep The Ball In Play
item.itunes:title: #1468 Just Keep The Ball In Play
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Drew's recent French lessons he's been taking in advance of his trip to France. They then revisit a Loveline clip from 1997 as Adam points out how far ahead of the curve he was and Adam once again plays the classic Deacon Jones clip and asks Drew to listen to the grammar specifically. They then turn to the phones and speak with an international caller whose wife has been having miscarriages and is looking for advice on handling the corresponding depression from losing the pregnancies.
Please Support Our Sponsors: JoinFightCamp.com/ADS TenThousand.CC, code ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM Pluto TV

item.title: #1467 Feelings vs. Mechanics
item.itunes:title: #1467 Feelings vs. Mechanics
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show discussing Drew's bout with diverticulitis and Adam's lack of ability to empathize with people who are in pain or struggling with something. The conversation then turns to Afghanistan and how the American pull out of armed forces was handled. They also touch on the efficacy of masks and how that information has played into covid messaging. They also turn to the phones and speak with a caller who is looking for thoughts on where we are as a nation approaching the 20th anniversary of the 9/11 tragedy.
Please Support Our Sponsors: TommyJohn.com/ADS The Jordan Harbinger Show Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM Pluto TV

item.title: #1466 It's Nice To Know What Works
item.itunes:title: #1466 It's Nice To Know What Works
item.description:
Today's show begins with a conversation about Dr. Drew damaging the new studio console with his doodling. The guys then take a call about addressing people by their proper pronouns, as well as the FDA approval of the Pfizer vaccine. From there, Ace and Drew talk with callers about being a new dad, and Love Boat conspiracy theories. As the show wraps up, the guys look back on a hilarious Man Show clip.

item.title: #1465 Calling a Malamute a Shih Tzu
item.itunes:title: #1465 Calling a Malamute a Shih Tzu
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show continuing their conversation from Monday about the events of January 6th and more specifically the language that was used by the media and how despite changes in information the messaging hasn't changed at all. They also turn to the phones and speak to callers with questions on topics from Covid death rate in the military to vaccines helping reverse loss of taste and smell and more. As the show wraps up the guys discuss pronouns as they attempt to understand the phenomenon.

item.title: #1464 Surprise Surprise
item.itunes:title: #1464 Surprise Surprise
item.description:
Adam and Dr. Drew open the show giving a quick recap of the recent Carolla Family BBQ before moving on to an update on the current state of Covid treatments that are available to the public. They also speak with some callers including a returning caller who decided not to take the vaccine after a previous call in but is now concerned about the variants and is looking for advice. The conversation then turns to the events of January 6th and the recent report by the FBI which found little to no evidence of organization therein.
Please Support Our Sponsors: BlindsGalore.com, tell them Adam sent you ZipRecruiter.com/ADS Lifelock.com, promo code ADAM Pluto TV
